title: What is the significance of the biblical phrase "do not cast your pearls before swine"?
first_phrase: This text is discussing the teachings of Jesus Christ and how they relate to the salvation of all people. It also talks about the traditional terms used to express these teachings. The author cites A. Reghini's book, "E. Cornelio Agrippa e Io sua Magia" to support his argument. At the end of the previous section, the author mentioned the importance of not giving holy things to dogs and not casting pearls before swine. In the last 200 tokens, the author explains how these teachings were difficult to follow but the democratic spirit of Christianity eventually prevailed. The belief in the natural equality of all humans has become an accepted and unconscious postulate in many spiritual practices, even those not associated with Christianity. Some contemporary movements have even incorporated the scientific theory of evolution into their beliefs about salvation.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the belief in the natural equality of all human beings and the possibility of salvation through faith in a higher power has remained a postulate in many spiritual beliefs. The fear of divine punishment has been used by some contemporary sects to validate their doctrines. However, it is important to remember that the concept of divine anger does not necessarily conflict with the notion of divine perfection.
